verses.verse: For the Chief Musician. A Psalm of David. How long, O <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>? wilt thou <S%H7911>forget<s%> me for <S%H5331>ever<s%>? How long wilt thou <S%H5641>hide<s%> thy face from <S%H6440>me<s%>?

How long shall I <S%H7896>take<s%> <S%H6098>counsel<s%> in my <S%H5315>soul<s%>, Having <S%H3015>sorrow<s%> in my <S%H3824>heart<s%> all the <S%H3119>day<s%>? How long shall mine <S%H341>enemy<s%> be exalted over <S%H7311>me<s%>?
Consider <S%H5027><s%> and <S%H6030>answer<s%> <S%H3068>me<s%>, O Jehovah my <S%H430>God<s%>: <S%H215>Lighten<s%> mine <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, lest I <S%H3462>sleep<s%> the sleep of <S%H4194>death<s%>;
Lest mine <S%H341>enemy<s%> <S%H559>say<s%>, I have <S%H3201>prevailed<s%> against <S%H6862>him<s%>; Lest mine adversaries <S%H1523>rejoice<s%> when I am <S%H4131>moved<s%>.
But I have <S%H982>trusted<s%> in thy <S%H2617>lovingkindness<s%>; My <S%H3820>heart<s%> shall <S%H1523>rejoice<s%> in thy <S%H3444>salvation<s%>.
I will <S%H7891>sing<s%> unto <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>, Because he hath dealt bountifully with <S%H1580>me<s%>.
